job_title: Sport Partnerships & Experiential Marketing, Senior Specialist (North FL based)
job_description:
Are you a marketer with passion and knowledge for working with professional sports and athletic ventures? Would you enjoy a role where you can blend your marketing skills with the fast-paced world of sports? Do you bring a strong background in event management and execution? Have you been complimented on your ability to adapt and manage change on the fly? If so, read on and get ready to apply!

GuideWell and its family of forward-thinking companies are focused on helping people and communities achieve better health and are at the forefront in the transformation of health care.

Florida Blue, a GuideWell Company, has been providing health insurance to residents of Florida for 75 years. Driven by its mission of helping people and communities achieve better health, the company serves more than five million health care members across the state. We are looking for exceptional people who will bring our mission to life and succeed by putting the member first.

Job Summary
The Experiential Marketing Senior Specialist will lead regional sports partnerships in their entirety, provide activation support for a large number of sport partnerships statewide and support the Senior Manager with multiple additional partnership programs as needed. The role is responsible for managing all aspects of sport marketing partnerships specific to their region, beginning with the development of strategic event plans through the execution stage. This includes relationship management, contract negotiations, and collaboration with clients and partners to fully execute partnership agreements. This position is for a seasoned Experiential Marketing professional with expertise across a wide variety of event activation and sponsorship types. You will work side by side with the the Experiential Marketing Senior Manager in developing and executing event activations and fulfilling sponsorship benefits. This position will support internal and external experiential marketing programs, including sports sponsorships, event marketing, grassroots activation, trade shows, community events, and more. You will be responsible for leading the onsite activation at events in your region, including logistics, setup/breakdown, quality control, and overall execution. You will also support large scale event activations statewide, in partnership with your counterparts. To be successful as the Senior Specialist for Experiential Marketing, you should have strong leadership, strategic planning, project management, interpersonal and decision-making skills. You will need to maintain a strong level of accountability, keen attention to detail, and have the ability to develop and maintain relationships while working with cross functioning teams.
• *Important Information**

- The candidate selected for this role will live in a North FL based area.

- While this role does include remote work, this position is considered hybrid with statewide travel to meet the needs of the position. There is an expectation for a 2x/week on-site attendance to manage work related promotional assets at our downtown location in Jacksonville (532 Riverside Ave, Jacksonville, FL 32202)

- This role does require FL statewide travel, primarily during the months of Sep- Dec during Open Enrollment.

What You Will Be Doing:
• MANAGE PARTNERSHIPS AND ACTIVATION
• Lead execution of Experiential Marketing events from inception to completion in their entirety
• North Florida Market Experiential Lead and Local Presence (LP) Liaison
• Develop and communicate written briefs for use by agencies or retail agents (e.g., previews, promotional items, etc.) to direct their activations in order to generate effective activations and results
• Lead customization and implementation of integrated marketing communication and asset activation plans by coordinating internal and external functions (e.g. marketing assets & sponsorships in order to achieve high performance results on time and within budget)
• Ensure all partnerships and contract benefits are fulfilled and executed at 100%
• Ideation of event activations aligning with regional objectives
• Participate in and assist with contract negotiations
• EXPERIENTIAL MARKETING TRACKING AND REPORTING
• Report on event results and outcomes, including KPI, lead generation, member engagement, and sales conversions
• Tracking and archiving social media posts from partnerships and clients
• Distribution of Experiential Marketing monthly and annual report
• Manage and maintain Experiential Marketing event calendar and ensure all events are loaded and reflected on our Master Calendar
• Responsible for retrieving all Experiential sales lead reports and sharing results with regional FM and LP teams
• Experiential Marketing inbox management
• Submission of creative requests for all sport partnerships in their entirety
• Storytelling: Ensuring our work is captured and archived to allow us to provide recap details to internal partners
• Archiving: Ensuring all historical files are stored on aligning platform, including event footage, recap videos, event recaps, photos, planning documents, partner files, capturing partner meeting minutes, etc.
• Maintaining our regional benefit overview spreadsheets to ensure contractual benefits and demographics are updated at the beginning of each year
• CHANNEL/CLIENT SUPPORT & COMPLIANCE
• Ensure event management steps outlined above are conducted in correlation with the Field & Experiential Marketing scorecard goals
• Support leadership with any internal or external client support as needed
• Support Experiential asset and inventory management as needed
• Collaborating with internal teams and external agencies/brand partners to ensure flawless execution across all operations and logistics
• Innovation: Seeks out and shares best in class event practices, new technologies, and industry benchmarks to ensure world class event execution
• Responsible for ensuring all sweepstake rules are approved by Legal

• When applicable, selecting and reaching out to sweepstake winners for sweepstake completion.
• Responsible for Enterprise marketing and Enterprise Communication approvals across all partnership initiatives
• Management of local warehouse containing promotional assets. In office Warehouse support 2 – 3 days a week in North Florida region.
• The essential functions listed represent the major duties of this role, additional duties may be assigned.

What You Must Have:

4+ years related work experience. Experience Details: Event Management, Grassroots and Tour activations, Social Media, Viral/WOM Marketing, Field Marketing, Advertising, PR, Campaign Integration, marketing strategy and multicultural consumer engagement.

Related Bachelor’s degree or additional related equivalent work experience Event Management, Grassroots and Tour activations, Social Media, Viral/WOM Marketing, Field Marketing, Advertising, PR, Campaign Integration, marketing strategy and multicultural consumer engagement.

Demonstrated program management, asset optimization, and coordination experience.
Must be able to influence without authority and work with all levels of the enterprise.
Must be able to multi-task under pressuring deadlines and manage cross-functional teams, agencies and direct reports through tight schedules.
Minimum 30% travel required. Overnight travel, which may include weekends. Frequent travel during Annual Election Period and Open Enrollment Period (October – February).
Exceptional oral and written communication skills.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Presentation skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Power Point, Excel, Canva, MS Teams, and Share Point.

What We Would Prefer You Have:
Master’s degree in a related field

Knowledge of principles and practices of health care industry, to include Health Care Reform and Medicare. Product development, marketing or sales experience.

General Physical Demands
Medium work: Exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally and/or up to 20 pounds of force frequently to move objects.

Physical/Environmental Activities
Must be able to travel to multiple locations for work (i.e. travel to attend meetings, events, conferences). Frequently May be exposed to outdoor weather conditions of cold, heat, wet, and humidity. Frequently May be exposed to outdoor or warehouse conditions of loud noises, vibration, fumes, dust, odors, and mists. Occasionally Must be able to ascend and descend ladders, stairs, or other equipment. Occasionally

What We Offer:
As a Florida Blue employee, you will thrive in our Be Well, Work Well, GuideWell culture where being well as an individual, and working well as a team, are both important in serving our members and communities.

To support your wellbeing, comprehensive benefits are offered. As an employee, you will have access to:
• Medical, dental, vision, life and global travel health insurance;
• Income protection benefits: life insurance, Short- and long-term disability programs;
• Leave programs to support personal circumstances;
• Retirement Savings Plan includes employer contribution and employer match;
• Paid time off, volunteer time off, 10 holidays and two flexible Well-Being days
• Additional voluntary benefits available; and
• A comprehensive wellness program

Employee benefits are designed to align with federal and state employment laws. Benefits may vary based on the state in which work is performed. Benefits for intern, part-time and seasonal employees may differ.

To support your financial wellbeing, we offer competitive pay as well as opportunities for incentive or commission compensation. We also conduct regular annual reviews with pay for performance considerations for base pay increases.

Typical Annualized Hiring Range: $68,100 - $85,000

Annualized Salary Range: $68,100 - $110,600

Final pay will be determined with consideration of market competitiveness, internal equity, and the job-related knowledge, skills, training, and experience you bring.

We are an Equal Opportunity/Protected Veteran/Disabled Employer committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable culture for our employees and communities.
